{"type":"Layout","key":null,"props":{"title":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"Daily Note"}},"children":[{"type":"Seo","key":null,"props":{}},{"type":"div","key":null,"props":{"className":"flex flex-col items-center","children":[{"type":"div","key":null,"props":{"className":"textbox","children":[{"type":"p","key":null,"props":{"children":"Getting into good condition:"}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"get into mode"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"这个短语通常指的是让自己进入某种情绪状态或工作状态，以便更好地完成某项任务。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：Before starting the project, she took a moment to get into work mode."}},"
"]}},{"type":"p","key":null,"props":{"children":"Surrender to the world:"}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"bend to it"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"短语“bend to it”意指屈从或顺从某事，通常在面对压力或不得已的情况下改变原本的立场或行动计划。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"Despite his initial resistance, he eventually had to bend to it and follow the new company policy.""}},"
"]}},{"type":"p","key":null,"props":{"children":"Refuse advisor's requests:"}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"I have another commitment"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"中文解释：这句话表示某人已经有一个已经安排好的其他事情或任务，无法参与当前请求或活动。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：I'm sorry, I can't attend the meeting tomorrow because I have another commitment."}},"
"]}},{"type":"p","key":null,"props":{"children":"Meet Jordan randomly:"}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"bump into"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":""撞见"或"偶遇"，意思是意外地遇到某人或某物。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：I bumped into my old friend at the grocery store yesterday."}},"
"]}},{"type":"p","key":null,"props":{"children":"Team Meeting:"}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"hop on"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"“Hop on” 是一个非正式表达，意思是快速或轻松地登上（通常是指交通工具）。在中文中，可以解释为"跳上"或"搭乘"。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"Let's hop on the next bus to get to the city center.""}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"out and about"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"短语“out and about”通常指某人外出活动、忙于处理事情或在户外四处走动。它意味着一个人离开了家，在公共场合活跃。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：After being sick for a week, it feels good to be out and about again."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"get your feet wet"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"中文解释：这个短语意思是试探或开始做一件新事，以获得初步的经验或了解，而不是彻底投入或承担全部的责任。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：Before committing to the full-time job, she decided to get her feet wet with a part-time position to see if she enjoyed the work."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"dive right in"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"“Dive right in” 可以翻译为“立刻投入”或“不加犹豫地开始”。这个短语用来形容某人迅速而坚定地开始一项任务或活动，而没有在事前做过多的准备或思考。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"Instead of hesitating, she decided to dive right in and start her new project.""}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"upscale"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":""升级"或"高档"通常用于描述某物的提高版本或品质提升，尤其是在产品、服务或场所方面。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：The new restaurant in town offers an upscale dining experience with gourmet dishes and elegant decor."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"sketchy"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"在中文中，“sketchy”通常形容某事不完整或可疑，可能存在不确定性或者不可信。例如，一个计划或地点 Situation 被称为“sketchy”时，可能意味着这个计划不够详细或这个地方看起来不太安全。 Dangerous, Violent"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"That neighborhood looks sketchy, so let's avoid walking there at night.""}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"wonky"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"中文解释："Wonky" 指的是某物不稳定、不牢固或运作不正常。通常用来形容物品、设备或者状况有些失衡或不对劲。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：The chair is a bit wonky, so be careful when you sit on it."}},"
"]}},{"type":"p","key":null,"props":{"children":"Business:"}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"niceties"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":""Niceties" 在中文中可以解释为礼节、客套、细微之处或细节等。通常用来指社交互动中的礼貌或礼节，或在细节上的讲究和注意。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"It's important to observe the niceties when meeting someone from a different culture." 
(在与来自不同文化的人会面时，注意礼节是很重要的。)"}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"cross-check"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":""交叉检验"或"核对"是指通过多种方法或多种来源来验证信息的准确性和可靠性。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：The accountant decided to cross-check the financial statements with the bank records to ensure accuracy."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"give credit where credit is due"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"这个短语表示应该把功劳归功于应得的人，而不是隐瞒或归功于他人。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：We must give credit where credit is due and acknowledge her hard work and dedication to the project."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"Clinch the deal"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"用中文解释：敲定交易。指达成协议或最终确定一项交易的过程。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：After weeks of negotiations, the two companies finally clinched the deal."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"What's the big deal"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"短语“What's the big deal”通常用于表达对某事的不解或认为某事没有想象中那么重要或严重。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句: "He was acting like losing his pen was the end of the world. I just said, 'What's the big deal? You can buy another one.'""}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"What's the deal"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"短语"What's the deal"通常用于询问事情的真相、原因或细节，相当于在问“这是怎么回事？”或“究竟发生了什么？”"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"Why is everyone upset today? What's the deal?""}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"a side gig"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":""side gig" 是指一个人除了主要工作之外的兼职或副业，通常是为了赚取额外收入或追求个人兴趣。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：She started a side gig as a freelance graphic designer to earn some extra money."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"a side hustle"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"“副业”指的是个人在主要工作之外进行的额外工作或项目，通常用来增加收入、探索兴趣或积累经验。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：She started a side hustle selling handmade jewelry online to make extra money."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"deliver the goods"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"解释：“deliver the goods” 这一短语表示完成承诺的任务或实现期待的结果，相当于中文里的“不负众望”。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：The new software promised to increase productivity, and it definitely delivered the goods."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"a handshake is my word"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"这短语意思是用握手来表示承诺或保证，通常用来表达信任和可信度，表明握手和承诺的重要性。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：In the business world, a handshake is my word, and I always follow through with my promises."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"a joint effort"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"中文解释：联合努力，指两个或多个个人、团体或组织共同合作，为达到某共同目标所作出的努力。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：The new community center was built through the joint effort of local residents and the city government."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"a botch job"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"“a botch job”在中文中通常指的是草率的、没有质量保证的工作或修理。它是指某项工作没有被正确地完成，结果常常是粗糙或需要重新修复的。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
The contractor did a botch job on the kitchen renovation, and now we have to hire someone else to fix it."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"a bang-up job"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"用户短语“a bang-up job”用来表示出色、极好的工作或任务完成情况。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"He did a bang-up job on the presentation; everyone was impressed with his work.""}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"Micromanage"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":""微管理"指过度关注和控制他人工作细节的管理风格。通常指管理者对员工的各个细节进行严格的监督和干预。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：The new manager tends to micromanage the team, which frustrates some of the more experienced employees."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"Belabor the point"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"该短语意指对某个观点或问题过度详细地讨论或重复，使人感到厌烦。通常是在听众已经理解的情况下，重复同样的论点或细节。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"Please don't belabor the point; we all understand your opinion.""}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"a labor of love"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"“a labor of love” 是指出于热爱或激情而进行的工作，通常不以金钱或回报为目的。这样的工作虽然可能辛苦，却因为个人兴趣或情感而甘愿付出努力。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：Writing this book is a labor of love; I don't expect to make a profit, but I am passionate about sharing my story."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"a new lease of live"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"短语“a new lease of life”意为焕然一新或者重获新生，通常指某物或某人在经历困难或低迷后，重新充满活力或充满希望的状态。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：After the surgery, he felt like he had a new lease of life and started taking up activities he loved."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"In the market for"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"这个短语用于表示某人正在寻找或有意购买某种物品或服务。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：I am in the market for a new laptop because my old one is too slow."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"On the market"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"中文解释：这个短语通常用来形容某商品正在市场上出售或可供购买。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：The latest smartphone model is now on the market."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"priced out of the market"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":""被市场淘汰"是指由于价格上升，竞争者或者消费者不再能够负担某一商品或服务，导致他们被迫退出市场。这通常发生在价格过高，超出他们的支付能力或愿意支付的范围内。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：Due to the rapid increase in housing costs, many first-time buyers have been priced out of the market."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"Cut out the middle man"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"“Cut out the middle man” 这个短语意思是去掉中间商，直接从制造商或原始来源购买产品或服务，以方便省钱或简化流程。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"We decided to cut out the middleman and buy our produce directly from the farmers.""}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"get something for nothing out"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"这个短语通常用于描述某人没有付出任何努力或成本就获得了一些东西，意味着不劳而获。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：He always seems to get something for nothing out of every situation, never really putting in any hard work."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"Own it"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"中文解释：这个短语通常用于建议或鼓励某人承认或接受某事，尤其是他们的责任、错误或成功。它意味着自信地面对和接受现实。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：You've made a mistake, but it's important to own it and learn from it."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"above my pay grade"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"“超出我的薪资等级”或者“超出我的职责范围”。这个短语通常用来表示某项责任、问题或决策不在某人的职权范围之内。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：Deciding on the company's merger strategy is above my pay grade."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"go according to plan"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"中文解释：按计划进行，意思是事情按照预先制定的安排和步骤进行，没有出差错或偏离。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：The event went according to plan, and everyone had a great time."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"quick and dirty"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"“quick and dirty”是指在短时间内完成任务的方法，通常意味着质量可能不够精细或理想，但能暂时解决问题。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"We need a quick and dirty solution to get this project off the ground by next week.""}},"
"]}},{"type":"p","key":null,"props":{"children":"SuperIntro:"}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"knock out the task"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"“knock out the task” 是指快速有效地完成某项任务或工作。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：I managed to knock out the task in an hour, leaving plenty of time for other activities."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"get up and going"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":""起床并开始行动"或"振作起来并开始行动"。这个短语通常用于鼓励某人从床上起来，开始一天的活动，或者从消极状态中振作起来。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：After a cup of coffee, I was ready to get up and going with my work for the day."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"jump into any issues come up"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"这个短语表示马上处理或解决任何出现的问题。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：Whenever there's a technical glitch in the system, our IT team is quick to jump into any issues that come up."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"a bit of a stretch"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"这个短语意指某个观点、说法或解释可能有些牵强或不太可信，就像拉伸到极限一样。它表示某事不太可能成立或不可取。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：Claiming that she could finish the entire project in one day is a bit of a stretch."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"touch base"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"“Touch base”是一个英语短语，意思是与某人简短地联系或沟通，以便彼此了解情况或进展。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"I'll touch base with you next week to discuss the project updates.""}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"speculate"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"“speculate”在中文中意为推测或猜测。它指的是在不确定或缺乏完整信息的情况下，对某件事情进行预测或假设。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句："}},"
",{"type":"ul","key":"4","props":{"children":["
",{"type":"li","key":"1","props":{"children":"Investors often speculate on the stock market trends to make profits."}},"
"]}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"6","props":{"children":"投资者通常对股票市场的趋势进行投机，以获取利润。"}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"stay at the head of the curve"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":""保持在曲线的前端"是指在某一领域或某一方面始终保持领先地位，超前于他人或变化。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：In the fast-changing world of technology, staying at the head of the curve is crucial for companies to remain competitive."}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"putting that out there"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":"短语“putting that out there”表示把某事或某种观点公开地说出来，以便引起讨论、思考或比较。这通常用于表示自己的一种想法、建议或意见，希望其他人能看到并给予反馈。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"I'm just putting that out there, but maybe we should consider a different design for the project.""}},"
"]}},{"type":"StudyNote","key":null,"props":{"className":"","note":{"type":"Symbol(react.fragment)","key":null,"props":{"children":"open format"}},"children":[{"type":"p","key":"0","props":{"children":""开放格式"是指一种文件格式，其设计和规范是公开的，并且可以由任何人实现和使用，而不需要支付费用或受到法律限制。"}},"
",{"type":"p","key":"2","props":{"children":"英文例句：
"The company decided to adopt open formats for all its official documents to ensure maximum compatibility and accessibility.""}},"
"]}}]}},{"type":"audio","key":null,"props":{"className":"py-3","src":"https://github.com/YuantianDing/yuantianding.github.io/raw/refs/heads/main/en/src/pages/notes/dailynote/1/_allnotes.mp3","controls":true}}]}}]}}
